intro: Notholaena galapagensis, commonly known as the Galápagos spikerush, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and spike-like inflorescences that bear small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in wet, coastal environments and plays a role in stabilizing the local soil. Its morphology reflects adaptations to the unique ecological conditions of the Galápagos.
